availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Kentucky, resident and soldier. Tennessee native. Married to Catherine Elizabeth Dunn in Hardeman County, Tennessee, in May 1834. Father of William Dunn, Thomas Dunn, Richard Dunn, and Elizabeth Dunn. Farmer in Hardeman County in 1840. Farmer in Hardeman County in 1850. Served in the 34th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as private from September 10, 1863, to June 6, 1865. Deserted from September 27, 1863, to February 28, 1864. Discharged on account of disability on June 6, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Sixth Manuscript Census of the United States (1840), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hardeman County, p. 295.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hardeman County, p. 607.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 320.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0407.
KYR-0001-004-0769.
